result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Timothy Macdonald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today October 26, 2015 no later than 4:00 p.m.
Court authorizes transfer of Probation to to Eau Claire County.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Evenson ADA:  Edward Minser DF ATTY: Alex Andrea DF: Adam Timothy Macdonald appeared. Case called at 9:50. Atty. Andrea updates the court as to amendment of Count 5 to the same as count 6, possession of paraphernalia. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to amended Ct 5 and Ct 6 in 15CF284 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 5 and 6  in 15CF284. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: Sentence W/H
On Ct. 5 1 year probation with conditions:
- Costs 
-Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- Complete all programing as deemed appropriate from agent. 

On Count 6- Sentence W/H 1 year probation to run concurrent with Ct. 5
-Costs
- same conditions as count 5. 

DE to sign up for probation today no later than 4:00pm. Court will authorize transfer to Eau Claire County.    
DE to meet with the payment clerk.
for continuance of 10/5/15 - PH filed by  ADA Edward Minser.  eif
Preliminary hearing at 10-26-2015 10:00 am

Atty. A. Andrea. gme
Preliminary hearing at 10-05-2015 11:00 am

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,   Isaac R. or Allison S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Adam Timothy Macdonald appeared. Court confirms address.  Defendant is in long term treatment.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Waive speedy prelim (time limits).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.
